data.title: Thunderbird
data.meta_description: "Preparation, speed, precision. These are essential when it comes to saving lives. And that's how I fly."— Thunderbird Mina "Thunderbird" Sky is a Defending Operator featured in Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six Siege, introduced in the North Star expansion. "Ninety percent of all injuries can be avoided...
data.text:
"Preparation, speed, precision. These are essential when it comes to saving lives. And that's how I fly."

— Thunderbird

Mina "Thunderbird" Sky is a Defending Operator featured in Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six Siege, introduced in the North Star expansion.

Biography[]

"Ninety percent of all injuries can be avoided by paying attention."

— Thunderbird

Born in the Nakoda Territories of Saskatchewan, Sky’s first lesson from her mother was the importance of community. Her first introduction to engines was at her father’s knee, he taught her to understand helicopters before she learned to fly one.

Always eager for new experiences she enrolled in the Bold Eagle Program at seventeen where she excelled in basic military training. While benefitting from the guidance of community elders and indigenous instructors, this program sparked an interest in preserving and protecting what she loved most, the Nakoda way of life.

After joining the Canadian Armed Forces Sky worked her way through flight school. Remembering her mother’s emphasis on the value of balance, Sky felt since the CAF taught her to take lives, she should also learn how to save them. She completed her Basic Medical Training (CFHSTC) and continued to serve in the CAF as an Aerial Medic.

In 2015, she found and rescued Sanaa “Nomad” El Maktoub in the Canadian wilderness. After giving Nomad medical attention, they were attacked by a black bear while Sky was repairing her helicopter. Sky was able to successfully fend the bear off and flew Nomad to safety. This later led Nomad to recommend her to join Rainbow in 2021.

Shortly after her recruitment, Sky was left a note by what appeared to be from Nomad. It mentioned an issue with the CC-295 in one of Rainbow's hangars, prompting Sky to investigate. She found the landing gear's hydraulic line had been cut as well as her missing necklace lodged in the plane upon closer inspection. Sky was then suddenly fired upon and shot in the leg. She managed to get to cover and heard a familiar voice taunting her with a nursery rhyme. Sky treated her wound to stop the bleeding and then used a machine to release smoke into the hangar. She then flanked her pursuer and kicked her in the head, revealing it to be Karina "Nøkk" Gaarddhøje. Sky told Nøkk that she knew something was off as she knew Nomad had terrible handwriting ever since she received frostbite in the Canadian wilderness. Nøkk stated that she wanted to test Sky as she did not trust Nomad's recruiting intuition. Holding no hard feelings for Nøkk's actions, Sky placed a bandaid on her head and helped her up. Nøkk apologized and said that while she trusted Nomad herself, she wanted to know that Sky was capable of handling more than "war games". Sky said she understood but asked Nøkk to leave their aircraft alone the next time she wanted to test her.

Psychological Report[]

Gameplay Description[]

Loadout Primary

Spear .308

Assault Rifle

SPAS-15

Shotgun

Secondary

Bearing 9

Handgun

Q-929

Handgun

Gadget

Barbed Wire x 2

Bulletproof Camera x 1

Deployable Shield x1

Ability

Kóna Station x 3

A medium-health, medium-speed defender, Thunderbird's unique gadget is the Kóna Station: an automated dispenser which shoots out healing pellets to nearby injured operators.

When deployed, the Kóna Station will build up a charge and then wait until either an injured operators enters its range, or a healthy operator within range takes damage. When this occurs, the Kóna Station will fire a healing pellet at the target, similar to Doc's Stim Pistol. The target will then be healed for 30 health, with any extra health being converted into overheal.

Once the Kóna Station fires the healing pellet, the device goes on cooldown for 35 seconds.

Picking the station up once it fires a pellet and then deploying it again can allow the device to come back online quicker.

The radius of the Kóna Station is limited to 3 meters, so a player must be very close in order to be healed.

The Kóna Station can allow any downed Operators to revive themselves if they move into the Station's radius.

Similar to Rook's Armor Plates, the downed operator is in full control of when they recover from DBNO in this way.

The revive charge a downed Operator receives can be activated anytime before they bleed out, even after an ally starts and then stops a manual revive.

Each station takes 3 seconds to fully deploy on a floor or surface.

The Kóna Station has an internal priority list of which Operator to heal first, in the scenario that multiple injured Operators are able to be healed at the same time (for example, when the station's cooldown ends).

If multiple Operators on the same team could be healed at the same time, the Station will automatically target the player with the lowest amount of health.

If both an Attacker and a Defender could be healed at the same time, the Defender will be prioritized.

A Kóna Station can heal through holes as long as an Operator is within its radius and line of sight. This includes through Drone Holes.

A Kóna Station can be destroyed or disabled by the following:

Explosives, gunfire, and melee strikes will destroy the Kóna Stations.

Thatcher's EMP Grenades will disable the Kóna Station for 10 seconds.

Darts from Twitch's Shock Drone and Zero's Argus Camera destroy the Kóna Station.

Kali's LV Lances will destroy any Kóna Stations within range.

Brava's Kludge Drones causes the Kóna Stations to overheat and self-destruct when hacked.

IQ's Electronics Detector can detect the healing stations and manually destroy them by gunfire or by coordinating with her team.

Strategies[]

Synergies[]

The Kóna Station works well with defensive gadgets such as Deployable Shields, Jäger's ADS or Wamai's MAG-NETs, allowing Defenders to create a strong defensive position.

Additionally, an Operator that gets DBNO'd behind cover can often hold-out for long enough to be healed by a Kóna Station and self-revive.

Intel Denial such as Mute's Signal Distrupters, Mozzie's Pests, Solis's Electro Sensor, and Observation Blockers can prevent Attackers from discovering the location of the Kóna Stations. This reduces the likelyhood of Attackers being able to use or destroy the stations.

Rook's Armor Plates prevent Operators from being killed from excess damage - an Operator within range of a Kóna Station is likely to be healed before getting DBNO'd, but Rook's Armor plates almost guarantees this due to the increase to their HP (adding together for up to 175 effective health before being DBNO'd).

Additionally, anyone who avoids death and survives being DBNO'd thanks to Rook's Armor Plates can use Thunderbird's network of Kóna Stations to heal back up.

Oryx can use the Kóna Station to compensate for the HP loss after breaking through walls using his Remah Dash without wasting one of Doc's Stim Pistol shots. Furthermore, placing a Kóna Station near an open hatch allows Oryx to heal by grabbing onto the hatch from below.

Countered by[]

Like many Defender gadgets, Kóna Stations can be destroyed by Kali's LV Lances, Twitch's Shock Drones, IQ's Electronics Detector, and Zero's Argus Cameras.

Brava's Kludge Drones causes the Kóna Stations to overheat and self-destruct when hacked.

Ram's BU-GI can be sent around corners to destroy Kona Stations that aren't in line-of-sight.

When stations are placed behind Deployable Shields, the BU-GI can take care of the shield and the station together.

IQ's Electronics Detector can detect the healing stations and manually destroy them by gunfire or by coordinating with her team.

Thatcher can temporarily disable Kóna Stations with his EMP Grenades, denying their use to Defenders while still giving Attackers a chance to use them for themselves after taking control of the area.

Counters[]

Buck, Sledge, Ram, and other Attackers with soft breaches can play vertically from either above or below the site. This is likely to injure Defenders when a stray shot or two manages to connect through the rafters. Shots that hit a Defender's feet or shots that penetrate soft walls also deal less damage than normal. As long as the Kóna Stations are behind cover so as not to be shot from the Attackers playing vertically, they can allow Defenders to heal back up and re-engage gunfights.

Capitao's Asphyxiating Bolts and Fuze's Cluster Charge and can deal high amounts of damage to Defenders caught in the effect. Although this is unlikely to kill an aware Defender from full health, the Defender may die pre-emptively later in the round due to their low-health. Kóna Stations allow Defenders to heal back up as if they were never injured in the first place (and in some cases, benefit from starting a gunfight with a temporarily overheal).

Twitch's Shock Drones, Zero's Argus Cameras, Kali's LV Lances, and Maestro's Evil Eye (after being hacked by Brava's Kludge Drones) can all chip away at Defender health slight, causing them to be classified as injured. A Defender can then wait to step into range of a Kóna Station until they are about to be in a gunfight. This will heal the small amount of missing health, but also provide a substantial overheal to help them succeed.

Device Description[]

"Able to administer emergency aid unsupervised the Kóna Healing Station, like Thunderbird, is a friend to anyone on the field."

— Mira

When deployed on the ground, the Kóna Station acts as a point of safety for injured and downed Operators. All they have to do is approach the device, and the Kóna Station automatically boosts the Operator's HP or offers a revive.

Device Evaluation[]

Device: Kóna Healing Station

Operator: Specialist Mina "Thunderbird" Sky

Evaluation Lead: Specialist Lera "Finka" Melnikova

Upon examination I will say I'm impressed with both the creativity and technical ability Sky used to put this healing station together. Finding chemicals with biocompatibility and bioabsorbable properties was critical to the success of the polyurethane foam capsules. The sensor combined with its 360 directional rotation allows the station to distribute the agent unassisted, enabling the operator to focus on other tasks and strategic placement. The Kóna healing station is almost as good as having an extra member on the team. The addition of chitosan with the pressure from the expanding foam can seal a bigger wound than medical cyanoacrylate adhesives. I think Doc will be excited at the prospect of no longer needing to extract fibers from healing wounds.

The only downfall of the station is its inability to distinguish between friend and foe, though that likely wasn't a priority in its practical application. That and its inability to withstand blunt force trauma. While I focused on its capacity to administer medical aid, I did not neglect to test its defensive abilities. Withstanding damage from conflagration is a desirable advantage, I'm glad Mira found a way to incorporate the technology onto Sky's existing tech.

- Specialist Lera “Finka" Melnikova

Quotes[]

Thunderbird's Quotes

"Air or ground, you find your balance or end up with a face full of dirt."

Trivia[]

Thunderbird was accidentally revealed on May 18, 2021 in a post by the French Rainbow Six Siege Instagram account. She was formally announced on May 20, 2021 and later formally unveiled on May 23, 2021.

In the revealed trailer, Thunderbird pilots an AgustaWestland CH-149 Cormorant helicopter. In Royal Canadian Air Force, there are 3 squadrons that equipped that kind of helicopter, that means she could be came from one of those squadrons:

103 Search and Rescue Squadron

413 Transport and Rescue Squadron

442 Transport and Rescue Squadron

Her codename was suggested by Nakota consultants. In certain North American indigenous peoples' history and culture, a thunderbird is a legendary creature that is considered a supernatural being of power and strength.

Thunderbird features traditional warrior tattoos on her chin.

The back of her jacket features the word "Wagiya" which is the Nakota word for Thunderbird. The front of Thunderbird's jacket featured the Canadian Armed Forces badge during her reveal. This was removed with her addition to the Test Server.

Thunderbird's jacket originally belonged to her father.

The Kóna Station originally could overheal Operators 30 health more than the normal maximum amount of health. However, the overhealed HP would gradually wear off over time.
